title: UDL Strategy-Integrated Design for Online Lecture Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic instructional design and LMS (Learning Management System) operation experience
context.additional_context: Strengthening design competencies to meet diverse learner needs by applying UDL principles to online language courses.

learning_goals: Learners can apply the three principles of Universal Design for Learning (UDL)—engagement, representation, and action/expression—to online course design.
Learners can analyze barriers to UDL strategy adoption through collaboration with instructors and propose solutions.
Learners can design multimodal content (text/audio/video) in a Learning Management System (LMS) environment to enhance learner accessibility.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
